main event: Four moving lights were observed in the eastern sky over Ontario, Canada on May 21, 1964.
interesting points: The lights were moving from south to north, between 15-30 degrees above the horizon.
The lights had a reddish or orangish glow and a texture like a Roman candle.
The lights moved in an irregular manner, with the leading light pulling far ahead of the others.
The leading light appeared to turn east when it reached the northern sky.
There was no audible sound associated with the lights.
sighted object: four moving lights in the sky
photographs: no, the report does not mention any photographs
